pli-tv-pvr2.10:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr2.10:0.4: The section on how many offenses
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.0: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.1: (5) How many kinds of offences does one commit as a result of consenting to physical contact?
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.2: One commits five kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.3: when a lustful nun consents to a lustful man taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.4: when a monk touches body with body, he commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.5: when one touches what is connected to the body with the body, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.6: when one touches what is connected to the body with what is connected to the body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.7: for tickling, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.1: (6) How many kinds of offences does one commit as a result of concealing offences?
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.2: One commits four kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.3: when a nun knowingly conceals an offense entailing expulsion, she commits an offense involving expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.4: when, being unsure, she conceals it, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.5: when a monk conceals an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.6: when he conceals a failure in conduct, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.1: (7) “How many kinds of offences does one commit as a result of not stopping when pressed up to the third time?”
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.3: when a nun takes sides with one who has been ejected and does not stop when pressed up to the third time, then after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.4: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.5: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.6: If a nun who is an imitator of a schismatic does not give up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time there is an offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.7: If she does not give up (her) pernicious views though being admonished up to the third time there is an offence of Expiation.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.8: Because of not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time she falls into these five offences. [3]
pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.1: (8) “How many kinds of offences does one commit as a result of   ?”
pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.7: she falls into these three offences. [4]
pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.8: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:15.1: The ten rules entailing suspension are finished. …
pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.1: Because of partaking of curds, having had them asked for, …
pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.3: If she accepts them, saying, “I will eat, I will partake of” there is an offence of wrong-doing.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.4: For every mouthful there is an offence to be Confessed.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.5: Because of partaking of curds, having had them asked for, she falls into these two offences. [8]
pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.6: Concluded is the Second Chapter: on How Many Offences?
